description: Ancient ruins of the great city of Shandora, home to the Poneglyph that the Shandia have protected for 800 years. The site of the climactic battles of the Skypiea arc.

keyEvents.event: Enel reveals his Fairy Vearth plan and intention to destroy Skypiea
keyEvents.significance: The ruins serve as the stage for Enel's revelation of his ultimate plans

keyEvents.event: Multiple battles take place: Gan Fall vs Enel, Robin vs Enel, Zoro vs Enel, Wyper vs Enel
keyEvents.significance: The ruins become the battleground for the climactic confrontations with Enel

keyEvents.event: Wyper uses Seastone and Reject Dial to defeat Enel
keyEvents.significance: The first successful defeat of Enel occurs at these ancient ruins

culturalSignificance: Sacred site to the Shandia people, contains the Poneglyph they have sworn to protect for 800 years since the Void Century

description: The upper region of Skypiea where Enel rules as god. Originally part of Jaya island that was blasted into the sky 400 years ago. Contains the Shandora ruins and is the center of conflict in the Skypiea arc.

keyEvents.event: Enel announces his plan to abandon Upper Yard and let it fall to the Blue Sea
keyEvents.significance: Reveals that Enel views Upper Yard as limited and inferior to Fairy Vearth

culturalSignificance: The sacred vearth (earth) that has been the subject of a 400-year war between Skypieans and Shandia

description: The main inhabited island of Skypiea where ordinary citizens live under Enel's rule. Home to Conis, Pagaya, and other Skypieans.

keyEvents.event: Skypiean children discuss Conis and Pagaya, revealing social division over helping the Blue Sea Dwellers
keyEvents.significance: Shows the social impact of Enel's propaganda and the consequences of defying god

culturalSignificance: Home to the Skypiean population that Enel plans to destroy
